Archiving means, that the entity concerned is locked permanently and access is limited to viewing.

Depending on which entity is archived, potentially subordinated or related entities will be archived likewise.

E.g., archiving a dossier also affects its particle types, methods and reports.
Deleting an entity irrevocably removes it from the system.
Any recommendations given and results determined by the NanoDefiner are supplied without liability.

Editing means, that the entity concerned is changed in its properties.

Depending on which entity is edited, potentially subordinated or related entities will be archived, as they are not longer consistent.

E.g., editing a dossier's particle type also affects all methods as well as its report.

This web application does not support the Internet Explorer browser, please switch to one of the supported browsers listed below.
This is the NanoDefiner e-tool, a decision support framework for the characterisation of potential nanomaterials. It is one of the products delivered by the NanoDefine project.

The e-tool is tested with recent versions of Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome / Chromium, and Safari. If you are using a different browser and experience problems, please consider using one of the aforementioned browsers.

The measure Cm describes the percentage presence of completeness in the particle type description and will be present in the dossier report. The more known particle type properties are given, the more certain measurement technique recommendations will be. Hence, it is highly desireable to keep Cm high.

Definition of a new particle type
Please name and describe the particle type.

In the first step of material categorisation, please state the most relevant material properties for the following steps of the workflow. The expected particle shape, number of small dimensions, the particle multimodality as well as the state of aggregation will be referenced in regards to a possibly mandatory plausibility check for tier 1 methods.
Please state further primary particle type attributes. These attributes have high impact on the recommendation and should be stated.
Please state the secondary particle type criteria. These criteria have less impact on the recommendation. Submitting completes the process.
The following particle type attributes are unknown:

The measure Ĉm describes a weighted pendant of Cm and will be present in the dossier report. The measurement technique-individual weight of a particle type property adjusts its individual impact on the measure. For instance, given that a measurement technique profile weights a certain particle type property 50 % instead of 100 %, it only has half the impact on Ĉm than it has on the unweighted measure Cm. Given that a particle type property is weighted 0 %, stating it will have no impact on Ĉm. This allows to lower or eliminate the impact of unknown values for specific material properties that are less or not relevant for a measurement technique. Given a low Cm also a moderate to high Ĉm is possible. A high Ĉm is generally more desireable than a high Cm due to fulfilled description of more relevant properties. Please note: Ĉm equals Cm for default measurement technique profiles in the knowledge base.

Value interpretation for Ct and Ĉt can be adopted from intervals given for Cm and Ĉm.

Generating a new report for this dossier will archive any previously generated reports. Further, a currently active dossier report will automatically be archived if any information documented in it (e.g., descriptions of dossier, particle types, methods) are altered subsequently in the NanoDefiner. Archived reports can still be accessed, though.
Choose the methods to be included in the report
Please select at least one method!
No decision could be reached, see argumentation above
None of the configured tier 2 measurement techniques were both suitable for measurement given the material and available according to the user lab settings.

The measure Ct described the percentage presence of completeness in the measurement technique description in the knowledge base and will be present in the dossier report. The more described properties are given for a measurement technique, the more certain its recommendations will be. Hence, it is highly desireable to keep Ct high.

The measure Ĉt described the weighted pendant of Ct and will be present in the dossier report. The measurement technique-individual weight of a measurement technique property adjusts its individual impact on the measure. Ĉt works analog to Ĉm, but is focused on the relevance of measurement technique properties. For further information see the description of Ĉm. Please note: Ĉt equals Ct for default measurement technique profiles in the knowledge base.
Measurement technique was chosen despite being unsuitable for the material. See the appendix for additional details.
